alert.note: Alert for Clinton; Lycoming (Pennsylvania) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued August 30 at 12:58AM EDT by NWS State College
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 3 AM EDT EARLY THIS MORNING... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...A portion of central Pennsylvania, including the following counties, Clinton and Lycoming. * WHEN...Until 300 AM EDT. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 1258 AM EDT, Doppler radar indicated heavy rain due to thunderstorms. Minor flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly in the advisory area. Between 1 and 3 inches of rain has fallen. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Lock Haven, Jersey Shore, Mill Hall, Avis, Dunnstown, Flemington, Castanea, McElhattan, Waterville, Little Pine State Park, Mackeyville, Cogan Station, Trout Run, Salladasburg and Lock Haven University. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Be especially cautious at night when it is harder to recognize the dangers of flooding.
